ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] My bow staff thinggy?
ygData.msgSnippet: Salutations Christina! Thanks for the web site. I sent over there and took a look around. There is a lot of good information there, about different
ygData.messageBody:
Salutations Christina!

Thanks for the web site. I sent over there and took a
look around. There is a lot of good information there,
about different professions. I'm actually tailoring
now more than fletching but it appears that lots and
lots of time could be spent on these activities if you
really wanted to get good at it.

Apparently there is a market for this kind of stuff
though. I carry around sewing kits, patterns etc. with
me pretty much wherever I go lately and in the last
couple days I've had three people ask me about if I
was a tailor and could I do something for them.
At this point me skills are so poor that I decline
though.

The fletching question came about more from getting
the treant bow staff and wanting to turn it into a
bow. Well it's clear from the little I read on
fletching last night that even if I go get the rest of
the materials I need my chances of actually making a
bow are slim untill I had a lot more practive, so any
suggestions on how I would be able to find someone
with enough skill in bowmaking that if I gave them the
material and offered to pay them some platinum they
might make the bow for me?

:o)
Bran

--- Christina Norman <tina@...>
wrote:
>
> Fletching can be fun but it takes a lot of money,
> you can find more
> information on fletching and other trade skills
> here:
>
> http://www.eqtraders.com/learn/learn_fletching.htm
>
> It's generally cheaper to buy bows and arrows from
> merchants than fletch
> them. The best bows and arrows are fletched, but
> they're expensive to
> make.
>
> - Christina
>
> On Fri, 8 Nov 2002, Brangvyne Accampo wrote:
>
> > Salutations All!
> >
> > After wandering all over Nerrath and collecting up
> > various things and returning them to the head
> ranger I
> > was given 15 gold and a treant bow staff thingy.
> OK,
> > what do I do with this, or rather since I'm pretty
> > sure I can make a bow with it how would I go about
> > doing that? Can anyone help or give suggestions on
> > this?
> >
> > Thanks,
> > :o)
> > Bran
> >
